column4: Okay I have problems, first of all it's 64-bit Kubuntu, I know 64-bit distros are bad so I've heard, but just I hope you will try to help me anyways.
I screwed up the mount points, /tmp got the /home partition and /home got the /tmp partition
They aren't bad if you stick to 100% free software.
So I mounted them to different folders, cp -r'd everything on the /tmp partiton to /home2 (the real /home parition) and rebooted
now it works, obviously, in command prompt mode
but in graphics mode, when I type the password, the screen goes black and then it brings me back to the password prompt
